page.title: 11Beckenham Manor
page.content: Beckenham was first mentioned in the ninth century A.D. In the 11th Century the Domesday Book records that Anchil held the Manor in 1066 and Angscot held it after for Bishop Odo(half-brother of William the Conquerer),to whom it was given after the conquest. From the 11th to the 18th Centuries the Manor passed through the hands of various stewards,some of whom were closely associated or even related to the sovereign. In 1773 Viscount Bolingbroke and St John sold it to his nephew ,John Cator. In the nineteenth and twentieth centuries feudal rights were gradually eroded and the land sold by the Cator family.Part of the arms of the Cator family is found on the Cator Park School badge.
